overall_summary: The reasoning process focused on forecasting 96 future values using a 4-day hourly time series with daily seasonality. Analysts prioritized simple methods due to limited data size (96 points), ultimately selecting a 24-hour pattern averaging approach. While multiple models were considered (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing), the solution emphasized practicality given data constraints, with thorough evaluation of pattern consistency and outlier impacts.
common_data_patterns: Negative daytime vs positive evening load patterns
key_insights: Limited data size (4 cycles) constrains complex model effectiveness
Last-day pattern replication vs multi-day averaging tradeoff analysis
Explicit handling of hourly value anomalies (e.g., Day 3 positive daytime values)
Importance of maintaining temporal alignment in forecast outputs
6-decimal precision preservation for continuity despite 3-decimal inputs
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with detailed pattern examination and multi-method comparison, ultimately implementing a simple solution after evaluating data limitations. Included statistical considerations (mean vs median), error propagation analysis, and datetime alignment rigor.
